Hi Jamie, 

Confirming those changes have been made, pending the YouTube video from you as discussed.

Hi Heath,

We have a few tweaks to make to this page - see Spiro's annotations and new assets zip file.

Can we make the first section at the top a video rather than an image with video popup? Perhaps this is best achieved with rev slide… We already have a template slider with the yellow bar applied (https://visitlatitude25.com.au/life-at-latitude25/).

Let me know what you think 😀

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au

Hi Jamie, 

Confirming this is now added to the live site. It's in draft status and located here: https://visitlatitude25.com.au/?page_id=2469&preview=true

Please note, until it's out of draft status, some of the CSS is not rendering on the front end. You should be safe to publish it and then tell the bots to stay away as discussed. Let me know if you need a hand with this.

@joel Please put this on the live site, save it as a draft and let Jamie know the link. 

Cheers!

Hi Heath,

Thanks for getting back to me. We'll leave it for now but will think about updating it next month. Cheers.



Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

We opted for HTML blocks to create cleaner code for this page. If we used the built-in VC elements/shortcode's, the only ones that would really be of benefit are the text-block and single image block , and we would need to wrap a good portion of this text in classes to achieve the design. The majority of the images need to be loaded in with CSS as they are background images, and elements like the icons and bullet points also needed to be coded in. The raw html also aids in getting the responsive screens correct.

We can break out the design into text blocks and use rows and columns etc so that it resembles the layout of the front-end. Most of the classes can be carried over etc. I would need to bill for this though as we have already used well in excess of the 2 hours as discussed. 

It will take approx 1.5 hours to recreate using the VC elements and we may have to leave some items in raw blocks to work responsively. Let me know what you think?

Hi Heath,

I forgot to attach this.
Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Heath,

It looks great. Thanks.

Do you know much about how this was pulled together? Particular technical approach undertaken? The reason I ask is that there seems to be an over use of raw html blocks. I would have assumed a lot of this page could have been built with Visual Composer built in rows, columns and elements. They way in which it has been build kind of renders it un-editable (unless you know code).

What do you think?


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

The page is now ready for your review. Joel ended up doing the responsive as he went. So you may want to make some fine tweaks, but for the most part it's done. Here is the link to check: 
https://staging-visitlatitude25.kinsta.com/making-our-way/

Let us know what you think and when you want it pushed to the live site etc.

Hi Heath,

Thanks - how much longer do you think you need to get it complete?


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

Just an update on this one, here is our progress: https://staging-visitlatitude25.kinsta.com/making-our-way/

Outstanding is:
  • Some general styling
  • Fonts need to be loaded 
  • Add in the watermarked background images/badges
We have spent more time than expected, but I'm fine to wear that as promised. We won't be able to do the responsive views within the included 2 hours this month. We can either hold until next month, hand over to you to finalise the responsive or bill for the extra time. Let me know what your preference is.

@joel it's a big file 160MB, here is a direct download link incase the google link doesn't work: 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/35rdafc72ed7i93/J000155_NIK_Making%20Our%20Way%20To%20LAT25%20-%20Microsite%20-%20Design%20%26%20Production-20190218T070931Z-001.zip?dl=0

It's a new page for the visitlatitude25 site. Please have a look at the files and then we can talk through it tomorrow. Jamie is supplying a plugin to handle the map functionality. Cheers

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Here’s a link to a google folder with the design files and Progress Map plugin files.

Can you please give me an estimate completion time? Also, let me know if you have any questions regarding the implementation.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1jshN-VE38A_j5E3Z4Uf_WMN23uE415bh?usp=sharing <https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1jshN-VE38A_j5E3Z4Uf_WMN23uE415bh?usp=sharing>

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker’s Mark Creative

// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek <http://linkedin.com/in/jamieshek>

>
> Assuming you can send us the design files as well so we can grab the required elements? Also, looks like there is a new font in there (used on Melbourne, Sydney etc). Can you supply that or would you like those embedded as images?
>
> Cheers,
